item.title: 优衣库所有者第三季度营业利润大增 29%，并上调业绩预期
item.description: 日本服装品牌优衣库（Uniqlo）的所有者 Fast Retailing 周四称，其第三季度营业利润激增 29%。【原文：Japan's Fast Retailing , the owner of clothing brand Uniqlo, said on Thursday its third-quarter operating profit surged 29%.】

item.title: 受房屋建筑助力，英国 5 月经济增长超预期
item.description: 官方数据显示，英国 5 月份经济产出增长了 0.4%，增幅高于预期，这主要得益于住房建设的大幅增长，首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）领导的新政府将对此表示欢迎。【原文：Britain's economic output rose by 0.4% in May, a bigger rise than expected and helped by a jump in housing construction, according to official data that will be welcomed by the new government of Prime Minister Keir Starmer.】

item.title: 旅游业蓬勃发展，西班牙城市住房危机导致无家可归者增多
item.description: 弗朗西斯科-卡里略（Francisco Carrillo）躺在马德里一家慈善机构提供的新公寓的床上，如释重负地啜泣着，在此之前，他在一家剧院的密室里露宿了三年。【原文：Francisco Carrillo sobbed with relief as he lay on the bed in his new apartment in Madrid provided by a charity after three years of sleeping rough in the backroom of a theatre.】

item.title: 德国 6 月通胀率确认为 2.5%
item.description: 德国联邦统计局周四称，德国6月份通胀率降至2.5%，证实了初步数据。【原文：German inflation eased in June to 2.5%, the federal statistics office said on Thursday, confirming preliminary data.】

item.title: 解说：中国央行为何推出新的现金管理工具？
item.description: 中国央行本周以临时债券回购（repo）协议和逆回购的形式推出了一种新的现金管理工具，这是对其各种公开市场操作的补充，并可能成为一个重要的利率指标。【原文：China's central bank introduced a new cash management tool this week in the form of temporary bond repurchase (repo) agreements and reverse repos, adding to its various open market operations and creating what could become an important interest rate indicator.】

item.title: 人工智能狂潮使台湾台积电创下历史新高，跻身万亿美元俱乐部
item.description: 台湾台积电因人工智能应用需求旺盛，第二季度营收强劲，周四创下历史新高，巩固了其亚洲最有价值公司的地位。【原文：Taiwan's TSMC scaled a record high on Thursday after posting strong second-quarter revenue on booming demand for AI applications, cementing its position as Asia's most valuable company.】

item.title: 瑞士巧克力制造商巴里卡乐堡公布 9 个月销售额符合预期
item.description: 瑞士巧克力制造商巴里-卡乐堡（Barry Callebaut）周四公布的九个月销售量为 171 万吨，同比增长 0.4%，与分析师的预测一致。【原文：Swiss chocolate maker Barry Callebaut reported on Thursday nine-month sales volumes of 1.71 million tonnes, up 0.4%, in line with analysts' forecast in a company-provided consensus.】

item.title: 全球储备经理看好经济增长，但担心政治问题
item.description: 周四公布的一项年度调查显示，各国央行储备经理普遍对世界经济前景持乐观态度，他们认为地缘政治冲突升级是全球经济面临的最大风险。【原文：An escalation in geopolitical conflicts is the biggest risk to the global economy, according to central bank reserve managers, who are generally positive about the world's economic outlook, according to an annual survey released on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家：IBAT 首次在锂行业将新型萃取技术商业化
item.description: 作为全球清洁能源转型的一个里程碑，国际电池金属公司（International Battery Metals）成为首家利用新型过滤技术商业化生产锂的公司。【原文：In a milestone for the global clean-energy transition, International Battery Metals has become the first company to commercially produce lithium with a novel type of filtration technology, a step expected to usher in cheaper and faster supplies of the electric-vehicle battery metal.】

item.title: 解说员：日本为何尚未进行干预以支持日元？
item.description: 日元一天天跌至 38 年来的新低，市场参与者警惕日本当局会像 3 月份那样再次出手捍卫货币。【原文：The yen has been sliding to fresh 38-year lows day by day, with market participants on alert for Japanese authorities to step in again, as they did in March, to defend the currency.】

item.title: 早间竞标消费物价指数倒计时
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 对冲基金转向韩国，寻求下一波人工智能浪潮
item.description: 寻找人工智能相关股市便宜货的对冲基金正在抢滩韩国芯片制造商，押注新一轮对高端存储芯片的需求和政府支出会使它们更有价值。【原文：Hedge funds hunting for artificial intelligence-related stock market bargains are rushing into South Korea's chipmakers, betting a new wave of demand for high-end memory chips and government spending makes them more valuable.】

item.title: 美国通胀测试前股市大步迈向纪录高位
item.description: 周四股市上涨，从东京到纽约市场均创下历史新高，而交易商则在为美国数据倒计时，预计这些数据将显示通胀放缓，并为 9 月份降息铺平道路。【原文：Stocks rose on Thursday, with markets from Tokyo to New York at record highs, while traders counted down to U.S. data that is expected to show inflation easing and pave the way for rate cuts in September.】

item.title: 美元在美国通胀测试前漂流；英镑坚挺
item.description: 美元周四小幅下跌，但在当天晚些时候将公布的美国通胀报告公布之前，美元走势基本受到抑制，而英镑则因对英国央行（BOE）8月份降息的预期减弱而走强。【原文：The dollar fell a touch on Thursday although moves were largely subdued ahead of a U.S. inflation report due later in the day, while sterling firmed on receding expectations for an August rate cut from the Bank of England (BoE).】

item.title: 原油和汽油库存减少，油价上涨
item.description: 油价周四走高，原因是美国炼油厂加大加工力度后原油库存下降，汽油库存也有所减少，这表明需求有所增长。【原文：Oil prices edged higher on Thursday as crude stocks fell after U.S. refineries ramped up processing and as gasoline inventories eased, signalling stronger demand.】

item.title: 库克表示，如果失业率开始快速上升，美联储将做出反应
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周三表示，美联储正在密切关注失业率的变化，如果失业率开始快速攀升，美联储将做出反应。【原文：The Federal Reserve is closely watching changes in the unemployment rate and would respond if it starts a quick climb, Fed Governor Lisa Cook said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储库克：美国数据与软着陆一致
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周三表示，在失业率不会进一步大幅上升的情况下，美国通胀率应会继续下降。【原文：U.S. inflation should continue to fall without a significant further rise in the unemployment rate, Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said on Wednesday.】

item.title: ARK 投资公司的 Cathie Wood 在致投资者的信中为其战略辩护
item.description: ARK 投资管理公司（ARK Investment Management）创始人兼首席执行官凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）在周三晚些时候发布的一封信中为该公司亏损旗舰基金的策略辩护，她告诉投资者，当利率下降时，该基金的命运将发生逆转。【原文：Cathie Wood, founder and CEO of ARK Investment Management, defended the strategy of the firm's money-losing flagship fund, telling investors in a letter released late on Wednesday that its fortunes will reverse when interest rates fall.】

item.title: 被判入狱的华尔街名人
item.description: 本周三，Archegos Capital Management 创始人黄成国（Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang）在纽约的一次刑事审判中被判欺诈和其他罪名成立，此前，他的价值 360 亿美元的私人投资公司于 2021 年倒闭。【原文：Archegos Capital Management founder Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang was convicted of fraud and other charges on Wednesday at a criminal trial in New York in the wake of the 2021 collapse of his $36 billion private investment firm.】

item.title: 好市多批发公司将在七年后提高会员年费
item.description: 好市多批发公司（Costco Wholesale）周三表示，将从 9 月 1 日起，七年来首次提高美国和加拿大客户的年度会员费。【原文：Costco Wholesale said on Wednesday it would hike annual membership fees for the first time in seven years for its U.S. and Canada customers, effective Sept. 1.】

item.title: 亚洲 美国通胀报告将定调
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔驳回被解雇工程师就多元化培训提出的上诉
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周三裁定，霍尼韦尔在黑人生命至上运动开始后解雇了一名拒绝参加强制性多元化、公平和包容培训的白人工程师，并未违反工作场所反歧视法。【原文：Honeywell did not violate workplace anti-discrimination laws by firing a white engineer who refused to participate in mandatory diversity, equity and inclusion training after the Black Lives Matter movement began, a U.S. appeals court ruled on Wednesday.】

item.title: 太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）在美国劳工委员会关于遣散协议的案件中胜诉
item.description: 德克萨斯州的一名联邦法官周三表示，他将阻止全国劳资关系委员会追究埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司强迫工人签署非法离职协议的指控，以等待这家火箭制造商对该机构结构提出质疑的结果。【原文：A federal judge in Texas said on Wednesday he would block the National Labor Relations Board from pursuing claims that Elon Musk's SpaceX forced workers to sign illegal severance agreements, pending the outcome of the rocket maker's challenge to the agency's structure.】

item.title: 阿克曼称他的公司将向美国潘兴广场投资 5 亿美元
item.description: 比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）的潘兴广场资本管理公司（Pershing Square Capital Management）将向其在美国上市的新投资控股公司投入 5 亿美元。【原文：Bill Ackman's firm Pershing Square Capital Management will put $500 million into its new U.S.-listed investment holding company, the hedge fund manager said in a presentation on Wednesday.】

item.title: Archegos 基金创始人 Bill Hwang 因基金倒闭欺诈受审被判有罪
item.description: Archegos Capital Management 公司创始人黄成国（Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang）周三在曼哈顿联邦法院的一次刑事审判中被陪审团判定犯有欺诈和其他罪名，检方指控他在其价值 360 亿美元的私人投资公司于 2021 年倒闭之前操纵市场。【原文：Archegos Capital Management founder Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang was convicted of fraud and other charges by a jury in Manhattan federal court on Wednesday at a criminal trial in which prosecutors accused him of market manipulation ahead of the 2021 collapse of his $36 billion private investment firm.】

item.title: 花旗银行因未能解决长期存在的数据问题被美国监管机构罚款 1.36 亿美元
item.description: 美联储（Federal Reserve）周三宣布，美国银行监管机构对花旗集团处以 1.36 亿美元的罚款，原因是花旗集团在 2020 年发现的数据管理问题上未能取得足够进展。【原文：U.S. bank regulators fined Citigroup $136 million for failing to make adequate progress fixing data management issues the agencies identified in 2020, the Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday.】

item.title: 谷歌云计算负责人表示，谷歌正在探索应对微软许可做法的方案
item.description: Alphabet 旗下谷歌云计算公司（Google Cloud）负责人周三表示，谷歌云计算子公司将研究其他方案，以对抗微软的许可做法。【原文：Alphabet unit Google's cloud subsidiary will look into other options in its fight against Microsoft's licensing practices, the head of Google Cloud head said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国财政部官员：美国需要加强防御中国产能过剩
item.description: 美国财政部最高经济外交官周三表示，美国可能需要在关税之外采取进一步 "更具创造性 "的行动，以保护美国工业和工人免受中国日益增长的过剩工业产能的影响。【原文：The U.S. may need to take further and "more creative" actions beyond tariffs to protect U.S. industries and workers against China's growing excess industrial capacity, the U.S. Treasury's top economic diplomat said on Wednesday.】

item.title: SCWorx 公司前首席执行官因 COVID 测试被判定犯有证券欺诈罪
item.description: 美国司法部周三表示，医疗保健软件公司 SCWorx Corp 前首席执行官因在大流行病早期谎称该公司正在成为 COVID-19 快速检测仪的主要供应商而被判犯有欺诈投资者罪。【原文：The former CEO of healthcare software company SCWorx Corp was found guilty of investor fraud for falsely stating the company was becoming a major supplier of COVID-19 rapid tests early in the pandemic, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 诺福克南方公司同意执行脱轨调查建议
item.description: 诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）周三表示，该公司已同意执行美国国家运输安全委员会在 2023 年 2 月俄亥俄州东巴勒斯坦发生列车脱轨并泄漏有毒化学品事故后提出的一系列安全建议、【原文：Norfolk Southern said on Wednesday it had agreed to implement a series of safety recommendations made by the National Transportation Safety Board following a February 2023 train derailment in East Palestine, Ohio that spilled toxic chemicals,】
